item.title: Tata Tech & BMW Group launch BMW TechWorks India JV to drive automotive innovation; operations to start in Nov
item.description: Tata Technologies and BMW Group have launched BMW TechWorks India, a joint venture aimed at innovation in automotive technology and business IT. The venture, starting with 100 employees, will rapidly scale to a four-digit workforce by 2025, focusing on India’s top engineering talent. It aims to develop next-gen software solutions for vehicles.

item.title: Flextron launches rapid charging technology FlexStack for 2Ws
item.description: Flextron has launched FlexStack, an innovative rapid-charging technology for electric two-wheelers made in India. It allows EVs to charge 80% in just 10 minutes with Battery-As-A-Service. The system is scalable, easy to integrate, and uses advanced liquid cooling technology. The company plans to deploy 100 FlexGrid chargers in the next 90 days.

item.title: Japan's Nissan to invest in auto tech firm ChargeScape
item.description: ChargeScape, which provides software and technology to optimize EV battery charging, competes in a tight market that is dominated by Tesla and has seen newer entrants such as ChargePoint, Gridserve and BP Pulse.

item.title: Inaugural Autonomous BAJA SAEINDIA 2024 showcases India’s future in autonomous mobility
item.description: Autonomous BAJA SAEINDIA 2024 concluded at ARAI, Pune. Five engineering college teams competed in ADAS and autonomous vehicle technology. The Remote Driving System event highlighted precision and technical skills. Team IPS-Sprinter's from Indore won overall. Registrations for the 2025 edition will open in October 2024. The event showcased India's future in autonomous mobility.

item.title: Uber, Lyft drivers use Teslas as makeshift robotaxis, raising safety concerns
item.description: A self-driving Tesla used for Uber collided with an SUV in Las Vegas, causing worries about the safety of autonomous ride-hailing services. Federal and state authorities say drivers are responsible for their vehicles, even when using driver-assist software like Tesla's Full Self-Driving. Tesla is planning to expand its autonomous vehicle network.

item.title: JK Tyre partners with Vertelo to launch 'Connected Mobility Solutions' for EV fleets with real-time tyre monitoring
item.description: JK Tyre & Industries partners with Vertelo to provide connected mobility solutions for electric vehicle fleets in India using their new generation EV tyres with Treel sensors. These tech-enabled solutions will enhance fleet efficiency and performance. Services start from Mumbai with a dedicated team for round-the-clock support.

item.title: Exclusive: Reliance Industries appoints former Mahindra Electric VP Ashish Tarte as CTO- New Mobility
item.description: Tarte’s mandate is to oversee technological advancements, with a key focus on driving cutting-edge innovations in areas such as Mobility As A Service (MaaS), Battery As A Service (BaaS) , Hydrogen Engines (H2ICE), and other related areas for Reliance New Mobility’s Bengaluru division. These will be critical for sustainable mobility solutions in India, which Reliance plans to offer.

item.title: Nio partners with Monolith for real-time AI EV battery testing
item.description: Monolith already works with around 10 of the world's top 20 automakers test electric vehicle batteries using machine learning algorithms, including Mercedes-Benz, BMW and Honda, to speed up their development and help western automakers catch up with newer Chinese rivals.

item.title: Autonomous BAJA SAEINDIA to be organised at ARAI from Oct 4-6 in Pune
item.description: The competition was officially inaugurated at a press conference at ADYPU on September 30, 2024. This season's aBAJA has garnered support from 40 diverse partners in industry and academia, including Automotive Test Systems, Daimler Truck Innovation Center India, and the Technology Innovation Hub on Autonomous Navigation Systems at IIT Hyderabad. Major organisations like SAE International, SIAM, and AICTE are also backing the event. Registrations for aBAJA 2025 will open on October 6, 2024, with SAEINDIA seeking further support from additional organizations.

item.title: US lawmakers ask Mexican president-elect to address Chinese vehicle concerns
item.description: All modern cars and trucks have onboard network hardware providing internet access that allows them to share data with devices both inside and outside the vehicle.

item.title: AI shaping the future of autonomous mobility
item.description: Autonomous Driving has transcended far beyond being a moonshot idea over the last half-decade or so. Over the years, its popularity has increased as it promises to shape the future of mobility. The automotive industry is increasingly adopting AI technology to streamline operations and improve the overall vehicle performance. By tapping into the potential of big data, IoT, AI, and ML, artificial intelligence has completely transformed how vehicles are designed, manufactured, and driven.

item.title: STMicroelectronics introduces fourth-generation SiC MOSFET technology for EV traction inverters
item.description: STMicroelectronics has completed the qualification of the 750V class, with the 1200V class expected to be qualified by the first quarter of 2025. Following this, commercial availability will allow for use in standard AC-line voltages and high-voltage EV batteries and chargers.

item.title: ALVA collaborates with Google Cloud to enhance CX and support Indonesia’s green mobility transition
item.description: ALVA has chosen Google Cloud as its primary cloud services provider and is leveraging its best-in-class AI-optimised infrastructure, and data cloud and AI technology to drive targeted innovation across four key pillars – advancing targeted R&D efforts, empowering customer service teams with personalised customer insights, improving productivity of sales staff, and supercharging marketing efforts through the generation of locally-relevant content.

item.title: Hybrids compromise green mobility
item.description: As one industry observer puts it, “The façade of hybrids being green is a ruse; they are primarily fossil fuel vehicles dressed in electric clothing. When it comes to achieving zero emissions, only full electric vehicles can deliver.”

item.title: Delta Electronics to beef up R&D as more EV opportunities beckon
item.description: The company, which caters to charging solutions, recently entered into a pact with Tata Motors in the light commercial vehicle space. It now plans to strengthen its R&D base in Bengaluru to handle new opportunities both in India and even its global operations.

item.title: GreenLine and Sterlite Copper partner for sustainable LNG logistics
item.description: The collaboration commenced with the official flag-off of LNG trucks at Vedanta's Sterlite Copper Plant in Silvassa. These vehicles will play a key role in transporting finished goods to the northern region using a reverse logistics model, significantly improving logistics efficiency while reducing carbon emissions.

item.title: IAC urges government to recognise Auto LPG as eco-friendly fuel, pushes for tax reforms
item.description: The Indian Auto LPG Coalition has urged the Ministry of Environment to recognise Auto LPG as an eco-friendly alternative fuel. Highlighting its lower emissions and cost benefits, the coalition calls for supportive policies, tax incentives, and a reduced GST rate to promote its adoption and align with India's environmental goals.

item.title: Infosys to set up tech hub in Bengaluru for Swedish electric automotive manufacturer Polestar
item.description: Infosys has partnered with Swedish electric car brand Polestar to develop in-car infotainment, software, and cloud-powered digital services. Infosys will establish a global technology hub for Polestar in Bengaluru, focusing on EV software development and validation. This collaboration aims to enhance Polestar's product management and customer engagement through advanced digital solutions.

item.title: After BaaS, here's another concept for EVs called BaaB
item.description: Axrad Renewpower Agri Machines (ARAM), a Coimbatore-based startup, has unveiled a prototype of its self-charging electric light commercial vehicle (LCV), code-named ACV. This vehicle introduces groundbreaking technology, including the Body as a Battery concept, which integrates solar panels into the vehicle's body to generate power, reducing reliance on traditional battery charging methods.

item.title: Uber, Chinese self-driving tech startup announce partnership to launch robotaxis in UAE
item.description: WeRide's first collaboration with a global ride-hailing platform will help the company expand its reach beyond China, while Uber takes another towards incorporating robotaxis into its platform.
